article:
'Eyewear' consists of items and accessories worn on or over the eyes, for
fashion or adornment, protection against the environment, and to improve or
enhance visual perception.

Common forms of eyewear include glasses (also called eyeglasses or spectacles),
sunglasses, and contact lenses. Eyewear can also include more utilitarian forms
of eye protection, such as goggles. Conversely, blindfolds are a form of eyewear
used to block vision for a variety of purposes.
